Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
CAN: Draw basic shapes that might represent plants. (student attempts to draw plants but lacks detail)
Include elements like sun or water in the drawing without clear connection to plant health. (student might draw a sun or raindrops near the plant, without understanding their role)
CANNOT: Show the difference between a healthy and an unhealthy plant. (student might draw all plants looking the same)
Illustrate specific signs of a plant lacking water, such as wilting. (student does not understand or know how to represent wilting)
Illustrate specific signs of a plant lacking light, such as yellowing leaves. (student is unaware of the signs or cannot represent them)
Correctly compare plants with and without water or light. (student might not grasp the relationship and show misunderstood effects)
Use observations to convey that plants need water and light to live and grow. (student does not demonstrate this understanding)
